I joined Merrill Lynch before BoA bought over ML, and one of the great things about ML were the people and culture of "can-do".  During the financial crisis of 2008-2011, ML did let go of staff and they did pretty well to keep the good people.  When BoA took over and continued the retrenchments, it was bewildering to see BoA letting go of some of the really good folks - people who delivered results and gave the company its soul.  When I decided to leave, I must say there was no more reason to stay.

BoA is very process-oriented, and while I appreciate that stability is a good thing for a big bank, as a place to work, it was a con for me, as things moved just so slowly.  Perhaps because of the periodic retrenchments, there was a culture of fear and looking-out-for-oneself.  Most of the senior leaders I interacted with in my last 2 years were just trying to manoeuvre themselves into roles or positions to avoid the axe, and there was a real lack of inspiration and leadership.  I hear that it hasn't changed much since 2012.

pros:

cons: Do not compare Tech Company salary with Bank Company salary. Having that said, the salary is not competitive even compared with other corporate banks. Not by a long shot.
